articles.description: Manchester United are given a taste of what could have been as Harry Kane helps Bayern Munich to victory over Erik ten Hag's struggling side in their Champions League opener.
articles.title: Kane on target for Bayern as Man Utd beaten again

articles.description: Arsenal mark their return to the Champions League after six seasons away with a ruthless win over Dutch side PSV Eindhoven.
articles.title: Arsenal thrash PSV on Champions League return

articles.description: Jude Bellingham scores an injury-time tap-in as Real Madrid leave it late to beat Champions League debutants Union Berlin.
articles.title: Bellingham strikes injury-time Real Madrid winner

articles.description: Italy overturn a 10-point half-time deficit to beat Uruguay and go top of Pool A at the Rugby World Cup.
articles.title: Italy produce stirring fightback to beat Uruguay

articles.description: Premier League clubs will be updated on new broadcasting deal plans, financial handouts to EFL clubs and fixture calendar changes when they meet in London on Thursday.
articles.title: PL clubs to discuss calendar changes and new TV deal

articles.description: Manchester United goalkeeper Andre Onana says he has "let the team down" and that they failed to get a result at Bayern Munich "because of me".
articles.title: Man Utd lost to Bayern because of me - Onana

articles.description: British Gymnastics publishes a list of banned coaches and members - consisting of 62 people - as part of its plan to reform the sport.
articles.title: British Gymnastics publishes banned list

articles.description: Former British number one Emma Raducanu says she will return to tennis next season after undergoing wrist and ankle surgery in May.
articles.title: Raducanu to return to tennis next season

articles.description: All of England's players are "ready for when the call comes", says Jack Willis, before the team to face Chile is named.
articles.title: Willis 'prepared and ready' for England chance

articles.description: Neil Warnock's final game as Huddersfield Town boss ends in a 2-2 home draw against Stoke City.
articles.title: Warnock bows out as Huddersfield boss with Stoke draw
